item.title: Songs For My Father - A Look Inside author Ken Weene - Jun 08,2012
item.description:
One of or favorite guests is author and psychologist Kenneth Weene. He is an individual always willing to share his experiences, knowledge and expertise in the writing field. Tonight we will take a personal look at the man along with his first published book of poetry, short stories essays and plays, Songs For My Father. A bit about our guest - A New Englander by upbringing and inclination, Kenneth Weene is a teacher, psychologist and pastoral counselor by education. Having retired to Arizona, where he lives with his wife of forty-five years, Ken took decided to fulfill a childhood passion and become a writer. Kens poetry and short stories have appeared in numerous publications - both print and electronic. Tales From the Dew Drop Inne is Kens third novel, following Memoirs From the Asylum and Widows Walk. With two other novels and a novella waiting in the wings and a movie script currently under construction, Ken feels more creative now then he has ever been. Join us this as we speak of writing, marketing, and of Kens personal journey as an author June 7th, 9PM EDT, 8PM CDT, 6PM PD Call in @ 213-769-0952 to listen live or speak to our guest or visit our chat room

item.title: White Bridges - Historical Fiction - Guest Robert Rubenstein - Jun 01,2012
item.description:
After ready author Robert Rubensteins 1st historical fiction novel Ghost Runners I was in doubt he could pen anything equal to this superbly written account of the Olympic Runners experiences WWII era. Was I pleasantly surprised. A Jewish Book Council, Book-of-Note author, Mr.Rubensteins first novel was included in the United States Holocaust Memorial Museum library. Companion pieces:The White Bridge, a parody about the transformation of a young woman in a time of eugenics, baby farms, Hitler, the Klan, and the culture of lynching. Rob continues his inquiry to understand the hatred the horror,and the heroics needed to defeat fascism here and abroad. He teaches advanced topics in psychology, the psycholopgy of racism at a local college. A former special educator in the New York Public Schools. Rob raised two children as a single parent. He still loves the southwest, especially Navajo country, and gets his feet wet on the Coney Island shore. Call in to listen to the show live @ 213-769-0952 or visit via the chat room 9PM EDT, 8PM CDT, 6PM PDT

item.title: Dave Riggler-Life in a Wheelchair with Author Brian Hartman - May 25,2012
item.description:
Oana and I are thrilled to welcome author Brian Hartman as a guest on our show. Not only is Brian a gifted writer but one who has selected a topic most authors would shy away from - living with a disability. Having read the,aptly titled "Dave Rigglers Stories", which comprise of many shorts surrounding the life of the wheelchair bound Dave Riggler, I found it refreshing and so insightful and what a wonderful journey. Brian Hartman was born in North Arlington, New Jersey. He graduated from Ramapo College in 1992 with a BA in English Literature, and in 2000 from Rutgers University with a Masters degree in Library Science. "First Steps" is his first nationally published work. He also has a short story collection, "Dave Rigglers Stories." Mr. Hartmans website is http://www.brianswebpagehome.com. He can be reached by email at brian.hartman.author@gmail.com Join us as we speak with author Hartmann on his own writing process, living life as we call it disabled and take a look into the highs and lows of Mr. David Riggler. You may speak with our guest or hosts when we open the call lines or listen to the show live by calling 213-769-0952 or visit and chat with others via the live chat room. 9PM EDT, 8PM CDT, 6PM PDT.

item.title: A Poets Point of View with Salvatore Buttaci - May 11,2012
item.description:
Poetry lovers unite? Are you in for a treat as we speak openly with renowned poet and author Salvatore Buttaci. A humble, caring man who shrugs off his talent, being the true professional he is, takes time out of his busy schedule to assist upcoming writers. We are proud to call Sal a friend and moreso, pleased to have this opportunity to chat with him about our love,of poetry. Retired from teaching, Salvatore Buttaci is an obsessive-compulsive author who writes everyday. His work has appeared widely. He was the 2007 recipient of the $500 Azsacra International Poetry Award for the Taj Mahal Review. His poems, stories, articles, and letters have appeared in The New York Times, The Writer, U. S. A. Today, Cats Magazine, Christian Science Monitor, Wind, Chicken Soup for the Soul: Celebrating Brothers and Sisters, A Cup of Comfort for Fathers, and many other publications here and abroad. He has conducted countless writing workshops and is often the featured poet at various poetry readings. An activist for Sicilian-American pride, Buttaci has lectured widely on “Growing up Sicilian.” He is the author of A Family of Sicilians available http://stores.lulu.com/ButtaciPublishing2008 Some of his poetry collections include Coming-home Poems: Stops & Pauses on the Scrapbook Express (New Worlds Unlimited 1974); Promising the Moon (Buttaci Publishing 1998); Two Can Play This Game: The Saturday Afternoon Poets (with Paul Juszcyk; Cyber-wit Publications, 2004); A Dusting of Star Fall: Love Poems (Cyber-wit Publications, 2006); If Roosters Don’t Crow, It Is Still Morning: Haiku and Other Poems (Cyber-wit Publications, 2012). Listen via the chat room or call 213-769-0952. 9PM EDT,8PM CDT,6PM PDT

item.title: His Name is Pathfinder - He Speaks of Urban Lit - May 04,2012
item.description:
It Matters is pleased to have as our guest this broadcast the talented author known to his fans and readers as "Pathfinder". The Pathfinder is a writer, author, proofreader, poet, reviewer and contributing writer for the Urban Book Source. An avid reader, he developed a love of writing, and authored over 200 poems before parlaying his interest in writing into a passion for story-telling. He currently has three novels available (Fair Game, False Pretense and Deadly Consequences) on amazon and barnesandnoble.com. He’s a graduate of Queens College and resides in the tri-state area. Tonight we wil be discussing Urban Literature as we glimpse into his Suspense Thriller, "False Pretense". Join us via the chat room or call in to speak with Pathfinder himself @ 213-769-0952 9PM EDT, 8PM CDT, 6PM PDT.

item.title: A Journey into Fantasy with Guest Author, Melissa Studdard - Apr 27,2012
item.description:
Melissa Stud­dard is the author of the newly released best­selling novel Six Weeks to Yehi­dah and its companion journal My Yehidah. She is the winner of a first place Forward National Literature Award (for Six Weeks to Yehidah). Her poetry, fic­tion, essays, reviews and arti­cles have appeared in numer­ous jour­nals and antholo­gies, includ­ing Boule­vard, Con­necti­cut Review, Pleiades, Gradiva, Amer­i­can Book Review, Poets and Writ­ers, and The Smok­ing Poet. She received her MFA from Sarah Lawrence Col­lege and is a Cre­ative Writ­ing and Eng­lish pro­fes­sor for a com­mu­nity col­lege in Texas. She cur­rently serves as a Reviewer-at-Large for The National Poetry Review and Con­tribut­ing Edi­tor for The Cri­te­rion and Tiferet, as well as the host of Tiferet’s blogtalk inter­view pro­gram, Tiferet Talk. Melissa Studdard weaves a dreamscape for her main character Annalise -- a true Heros Journey in the Joseph Campbell sense. The story is delicate and poignant -- a far cry from the usual fare for young adults. The theme is universal, the writing is skilful, poetic and memorable. Dr Ian Prattis, author Visit the authors web-site: Melissa Studdard Join us 9P EST 8PM CST 7PM M 6PM PST or call in to speak with Melissa at 213-769-0952

item.title: We speak of Survival with Author Jana Chantel - Apr 20,2012
item.description:
Life has its ups and downs, yet how many can overcome the deep valleys of sorrow and come out a winner? This broadcast we will speak of Survival. Detroit native, Jana` Chantel, is a graduate of Grand Valley State University, where she received a degree in creative writing. Inspired by her own personal tragedies, Jana` lends voice to her pain in hopes of helping other young adults work through theirs as well. "The goal of this book is to uplift and inspire. Weve all been through some sort of adversity in our lives, by sharing mines, I hope to help others get through theirs. Ive been through it and came out standing. I want the world to know that they can come out standing too." --Jana` Chantel A fascinating true story that sears into the readers heart, Jana` Chantel presents the details of her tumultuous childhood in Detroit, of a woman whose memory of a violent upbringing is still fresh in her mind. She begins by recalling the death of her mother who was murdered in cold blood when Jana was just a year old. Call in @ 213-769-0952 or visit our chat room. 9PM EDT,8PM CDT,6PM PDT. Be sure to sign up to Authorsinfo & join It Matters chatroom & Group.

item.title: The Ups and Downs of Retirement with Author Phil Saylor - Apr 13,2012
item.description:
Ever think about retiring? Yes, so have we. Perhaps we should think about it a bit more. Were joined with author and businessman Phil Saylor, who says it best.... Retire is a word I never liked. The word retire, along with dramatic emphasis, sounds like you’re going to die. Of course, death is inevitable weather we retire or not. Wisdom satisfies the notion that sometimes when you don’t like something it’s just a pure case of tough stuff. In other words, the word retire is here to stay. I can’t do anything about it. I think it’s highly over-rated and for sure over-used. “You’re retired. So does that mean you don’t do anything, or is retired what you do?” When googling retirement, youll be bombarded with financial stuff and AARP insurance sites. That must mean you have to have money to retire. What a novel idea. Who would have thought? Money is a given. My contention is money is only part of what you need. One day you wake up and it happens to be your 65th birthday..., they stuff a gold watch in your hand, give you a cake, a pat on the back & send you down the elevator with a cardboard box of personal items from your desk, you’ve just retired. Congratulations! If you aren’t ready mentally to retire, then you’re in for the hardest time of the rest of your life. Most likely your spouse and friends will share in that misery. Call in @ 213-769-0952 to speak to our guest or visit via the chatroom. 9PM EDT,8PM CDT, 6PM PDT

Retirement | Retire To Not From | It Matters Radio Talk Show | Phil Saylor | Enjoy Retirement
item.content:encoded:
Ever think about retiring? Yes, so have we. Perhaps we should think about it a bit more. Were joined with author and businessman Phil Saylor, who says it best.... Retire is a word I never liked. The word retire, along with dramatic emphasis, sounds like you’re going to die. Of course, death is inevitable weather we retire or not. Wisdom satisfies the notion that sometimes when you don’t like something it’s just a pure case of tough stuff. In other words, the word retire is here to stay. I can’t do anything about it. I think it’s highly over-rated and for sure over-used. “You’re retired. So does that mean you don’t do anything, or is retired what you do?” When googling retirement, youll be bombarded with financial stuff and AARP insurance sites. item.title: Christine Agro, Metaphysical Feminist, Author, Clairvoyant, - Mar 30,2012
item.description:
Christine Agro, The Metaphysical Feminist, is an inspirational teacher, author, metaphysical expert, clairvoyant, natural healer and talk show-host who encourages women and girls to live a self-empowered life. Her book, 50 Ways to Live Life Consciously will be hitting Amazon by the end of this month. In Christines own words: "We have the capacity to self-heal, to transform our reality, to create the lives we choose. Our journey is about three things: learning, healing and evolving. Every challenge we encounter offers insight into what we are trying to learn and heal this lifetime." Christine’s approach is unique. Whether in a reading or a keynote presentation, she offers insight and guidance that gives YOU the power to change your own life. Find out more about Christines workshops, weekly meditations, and Femtalk by visiting FemSocial or The Conscious Living Guide. Join us as we talk with Christine Agro and delve into living a conscious, empowring and enjoyable life. Please respect our guest, though clairvoyant, we wish to allow her the time to speak of her wonderful works and educate us on Living Life Consciously. If time allows, Christine may be able to do a reading. To speak to our guest, call in at 213-769-0952 or visit via the chat room. Mark your calendar for Thursday, March 29, 9PM EST,8PM CST, 6PM PST.

item.title: A Candid View of Spiritual Freedom with author Chet Shupe - Mar 23,2012
item.description:
Chet Shupe is a successful electronics engineer who once suffered profound attention deficit disorder (ADD). With ADD, social relationships baffled him. After years of bewilderment and depression, his condition was finally diagnosed, and effectively treated. Suddenly, at 43, everything made sense. Shupe emerged from ADD with a unique perspective on the way society functions, both individually and collectively. As a scientist, he bolsters every conclusion with logical and compelling examples. As a person of feeling and intuition, he expresses his hopes for humanity with genuine compassion and sincerity. As a whistleblower to the world, he speaks with urgency about the need to make fundamental, radical changes in our way of life, if we are to assure the eventual well being of humankind. Why is our world essentially without relational intimacy, when that is what we want most is to love and be loved? And why are we destroying the habitat that we need to survive? To Shupe, the two issues are related, plus myriads of other ills from which our culture suffers. Shupe offers his answer regarding the source of these issues, and also suggests a path by which to recover our natural state of intimacy in our relationships and of harmony with the natural world. Visit Chets web-site @ Spiritual Freedom Press Join us March 22nd, 9PM EST,8PM CST,6PM PST via our chat room or by calling in to our live broadcast @ 213-769-0952.

item.title: The Magnesium Miracle with Guest Dr. Carolyn Dean - Mar 16,2012
item.description:
For over 25 years, Carolyn Dean, MD, ND has been inspiring and motivating people to be their healthy best. She is a health expert who was one of the first to see the coming obesity, diabetes and chronic health issues epidemic in the U.S. As a result of modern farming methods, she saw the depletion of vital minerals and nutrients from our soils and foods as a root cause of Americas health problems with over 75% of Americans not getting their RDA of the vital nutrient "magnesium". Radio, TV and magazines interview her regularly including ABCs The View, NBC and CBS. Know the Cause with host Doug Kaufmam, Your Health with Dr. Becker, The Womens Connection with Barrie Switzen, Weekend Today in NY, WNBC with Dr. Ian Smith, Health Matters with Christine Crosbie, Global TV to name a few. Shes the medical director for the Nutritional Magnesium Association. www.nutritionalmagnesium.org Join us this evening as we take a closer look at why magnesium is of the utmost importance when considering a healthy way of life. Call in to speak to our renowned guest @ 213-769-0952 or visit via the chat room. 9PM EST, 8PM CST, 6PM PST

item.title: A Journey From Darkness to Light with Guest Lloyd Rosen - Mar 09,2012
item.description:
Joining us on this broadcast is Mr. Lloyd Rosen, the author of Search For Happiess, My Journey from Darkness Into the Light. This is a feel good story of one mans life, Mr. Lloyd Rosens. He felt compelled to write his story in hope of saving many other people that suffer with depression. In the authors own words, he states " I want everyone to know through reading my book, that there is a light at the end of the tunnel." Well take you on a roller coaster journey from Lloyds teen years up to the present times. From therapy, ADD, failed marriages and ultimately serious suicidal tendencies. Again, quoting Mr. Rosen, " I wrote the book because you can get healthy and lead a very productive life, and make something of yourself." Depression is a very serious subject and something everyone will face at one time in their life. Join our guest as we openly discuss his life, his book, and what anyone can do to overcome deep depression. For this is a work created out of love, understanding and the need to help and reach out to others. Call in to speak with Lloyd Rosen live @ 213-769-0952 or visit via the chat room. 9PM EST, 8PM CST, 6PM PST.

item.title: Meet Animal Communicator & Lover, author Barbara Cyrus - Mar 03,2012
item.description:
Love Animals? Join us as we discuss, Out of Cages & Into Your Heart, with author and Animal Communicator, Barbara Cyru. In her own words: Hello. Im Barbara Cyru, born and raised in the USA. Have lived between 3 continents all my life, between Europe, America and Middle East. I have moved 26 times as well.. I have learned lessons in my life that words, visions and feelings create my reality. I am a European Certified Trainer, A Psychic, Animal Communicator, and I hold a degree in Human Services. I have been on the Metaphysical journey for over 18 years and have held Spiritual Development Classes for companies in different countries. I absolutely love being the voice of the Animals, they mean the world to me and give so much back in every single way. I am happy to be their voice and to serve them, they are for me the most wonderful and magical world there ever was in every single way. Come join me in the most beautiful world there is, The Animal Kingdom! Barbara Cyrus Call in at 213-769-0952 to speak to our guest or visit via the chat room by clicking on the show link. 2PM EST, 1PM CST, Noon Mountain, 11AM PST.

item.title: Can We Save Our Children? Guests Marie Crist & Pamela Wright - Feb 24,2012
item.description:
Marie Crist and her mother Pamela Wright have teamed up to help prevent child abuse and human trafficking, Both debut authors, Crist and Wright have released separate novels introducing readers to fictional secret groups dedicated to protecting the innocent. Readers find themselves rooting on these passionate citizens who hunt down and kill sick and twisted child molesters before they are able to strike again. Crist’s Citizen Out and Wright’s Justifiable:Oregon capture the emotions of anyone who has felt helpless in the wake of tragic violence or who works in law enforcement and understands the frustrations officers feel when investigations are hampered by bureaucratic hurdles. Crist lives in Pleasant View, Tennessee and her mother in n Glasgow, Kentucky. You may find Marie Crists kindle @: Citizens Out. and Pamela Wrights @ Justifiable (Oregon) Call in to speak with our guests @ 213-769-0952 or visit our chatroom showlink

item.title: Love and Terror in the Middle East with author Frank Romano - Feb 17,2012
item.description:
Frank Romano earned a PhD at University of Paris I, Panthéon Sorbonne. He is a Maître de conférences (assistant tenured professor) at the University of Paris Oueste in the Anglo-American Literature and Civilization Department and a member of the California and Marseille Bars. At present, he teaches law, literature, history and philosophy of law at the University of Paris Oueste and practices law in France and in the United States. The author actively organizes and participates in interfaith events involving Jews, Moslems and Christians in Israel and Palestine. item.title: Excercise and Nutrition with Trainer Sean Preuss - Feb 10,2012
item.description:
"The science of exercise and nutrition often disagrees with what has been ingrained in us as truth. Sean Preuss works to validate or dismiss those common dogmas of today. As a researcher, health writer, and masters student at Arizona State University, Sean reviews and conducts studies on how exercise and nutrition relate to pertinent issues like type II diabetes, cardiovascular disease, and obesity. Sean has also instructed over 5,000 sessions as a personal trainer. His clients successes have included losing 25 lbs. of fat in six weeks while exercising less than an hour per week, and helping a 72 year old man get back on the golf course in less than two months after hip replacement surgery. In addition to writing research-based articles for his website Health-Actualization www.health-act.net, Sean has been featured in the Arizona Republic and his articles have been shared in a number of gyms and newsletters across the country." Join us Thursday February 9, 2012 9PM EST, 8PM EST, 7PM Mountain, 6PM PST to discuss the importance of healthy eating and regular excercise. Sean will take question during the interview. Now is your chance to speak with a trainer who has viable and positive results for his clients. Call in live @ 213-769-0952 or listen via our friendly chat room.

item.title: An Introspective Look at Humanity with Author Kenneth Weene - Feb 03,2012
item.description:
A New Englander by upbringing and inclination, Kenneth Weene is a teacher, psychologist and pastoral counselor by education. Having retired to Arizona, where he lives with his wife of forty-five years, Ken decided to fulfill a childhood passion and become a writer. Kens poetry and short stories have appeared in numerous publications - both print and electronic. Tales From the Dew Drop Inne is Kens third novel, following Memoirs From the Asylum and Widows Walk. With two other novels and a novella waiting in the wings and a movie script currently under construction, Ken feels more creative now then he has ever been. As one author commented: Tales from the Dew Drop Inne" reads like a darkly humorous sitcom. The tone is both heartfelt and deliciously irreverent, showing that one does not need to hate humanity to appreciate the humor of life. Here are tales of drifters, alcoholics, religious renegades, veterans, and drag queens set in pub that is at once a confessional, a circus, and a psychiatric hospital. --Marina Julia Neary For more information on Mr. Weenes latest release, Tales From the Dew Drop Inne, available on Kindle @ Amazon Join Oana, Monica and Ken as they discuss the human psyche and all it entails. Thursday February 2nd @ 9PM EST, 8PM CST, 7PM Mountain, 6PM PST. Call to speak to our guest and hosts @ 213-769-0952 or visit our friendly chat room via the show link

item.description:
Lets double the fun this broadcast! How about a chat with two of the newest authors from the ATTMP family? Introducing Barbara Woolley, shell take you on a spiritual/mystical journey of the soul in her newly release novel, Out of the Box"A Souls Surprising Journey chronicles the 25-year modern-day odyssey of the soul now known in the spiritual realms as Lucerne. This saga of actively lived soul retrieval and karmic resolution begins with the authors sudden transcendent remembrance of being born into this lifetime. herself and others. At times hilarious, at times shocking, every word is true! item.title: The Old Silly at His Best - Meet Author Marvin D Wilson - Jan 20,2012
item.description:
Marvin D. Wilson has a widely varied and rich life experience background, from Hippie Rock and Roll musician,nightclub entertainer, Zen student,ordained Buddhist minister, carpenter, small business owner, network marketer,sales and sales training, skilled trades instructor and adult education teacher, to public speaker and motivational coach. Now in his chosen “golden years” career, a writer and multi-published author with the self-proclaimed, “audacity to write novels.” He is a professional editor, on staff with All Things That Matter Press and takesfreelance projects as well. Wilson describes his spiritual path as one who is a non-religious, dogma-free, maverick spiritualist Christian, with a strong bent toward Zen, Taoism, and the Law of Attraction, and who believes in the Oneness of all creation and all paths leading to re-awakening to the One. He is the proud father of three grown children and seven (and counting) grandchildren, and enjoys organic gardening as well as listening to, writing, performing and recording music—when not writing, travelling, and marketing his books. Marvin writes primarily in the spiritual/inspirational genre, but likes to pen “cross-over” novels that appeal to a wide audience. His books are uplifting, sometimes weighty, oftentimes humorous, abidingly thought-provoking, meant to instil and create passion and emotion, more than occasionally provocative to the point of controversial, and always “tell it like it is”, real world, no punches pulled writing. He likes to deliver spiritual messages in a non-preachy, often irreverent, sometimes sexy and ribald way, through the medium of an entertaining story. Check out Marvins Blog: The Old Sillys Free Spirit Blog 9PM EST 8PM CST 7PM MTN 6PM PST - visit chatroom or call 213-769-0952

item.title: Poverty,Spousal Abuse & Love, with Guest Author Alana Cash - Jan 13,2012
item.description:
My dad grew up in a community in Arkansas that is still reached by driving seven miles on a dirt road off a two-lane blacktop. He attended a one-room schoolhouse that is still standing and joined the military as soon as he was old enough. Every summer, when I was a kid, we drove 500 miles or so to visit the folks. Except for the long drive, it was fun because they lived like old-time cowboys – no electricity, no plumbing, no milk delivery. My mom took a lot of naps, but I helped my grandmother feed chickens and collect eggs, pick just enough vegetables from the garden for dinner (lunch) or supper, and although I stayed away from the cow, I shook cream into butter in a big mason jar. One day, when I was living in Austin, Texas, I asked myself: I wonder if my grandmother ever fell in love with anyone else and decided to write a short story about a love triangle on a farm in Arkansas. That story turned into 300 pages called TOM’S WIFE. The details of buildings, natural landscape and weather are accurately set on my grandparents’ farm. The characters of Annie and Tom Huckaby are composites of people I met in Arkansas with unique characteristics added. Jake’s character is based on reading Stephen Birmingham’s book, Our Crowd, the story explaining how the Jewish banking firms started in NYC by sending their sons into the South as peddlers then loaning out the profits to other immigrating Jews. Alana Cash is an award-winning filmmaker and author. She taught writing classes at the University of Texas Informal Classes in Austin, Texas, and was one of 60 U.S. teachers chosen to be profiled in the PBS series "A Writers Exchange." She currently lives in Los Angeles. Join us as 9PM EST,8PM CST, 7PM M 6PM PST 213-769-0952 or visit via our chatroom

item.title: Healthy Living with Special Guest Author Alle Wells - Jan 06,2012
item.description:
Alle Wells presents a new twist on Southern Fiction based on down-home inspiration. Her first published novel, Lame Excuses, illustrates the parody in life found only in the rural South. She also enjoys reading, writing book reviews, supporting the work of other Indie Authors, a vegan lifestyle and practicing yoga. Alle lives in North Carolina. Lame Excuses Brief Description: Addiction is a bitter word for the sweet pleasures that take over our lives. Taste the sweet pleasures that comfort Emily as a child in her parents’ café, inspire her as a culinary artist and lead her to an unsatisfied end. To find out more about Ms. Wells, sample some healthy recipes, read her creative blogs or sample an excerpt from her book. Lame Excuses, visit: allewells.com Join us in a delightful discussion on living a healthier lifestyle with tips and recipe advice from Ms. Wells. Call in to speak live with our guest @ 213-769-0952 or visit via our chat room. 9PM EST, 8PM CST, 7PM Mountain, 6PM PST .

item.title: An Open Chat with Author/Psychic Medium Cassandra Blizzard - Dec 30,2011
item.description:
Cassandra Blizzard is an accomplished, award-winning author, with over 30 novels to her credit. She has been writing since the age of 15 and has published numerous short stories, articles, and books. Cassandra is known for her skills in hopping genres. She has written in nearly every genre, including romance, mystery, thriller, science fiction, and mainstream. She has recently added to her list of writing accomplishments with a spiritual non-fiction series, the first of which is titled Seven Years of Surrender. In fiction, she writes page turning novels that keep readers avidly engaged. Cassandra’s non-fiction series, which just debuted, promises to be an eye-opening series of revelatory books designed to broaden the reader’s understanding of the soul and the spiritual realm. Cassandra also writes under the names: E.J. Deen, C.D. Blizzard and Cassandra Ormand. Cassandra is also one of the world’s most detailed psychic mediums. She is internationally known for her evidential mediumship skills as well as her psychic abilities, with clients on nearly every continent. Cassandra is known for her accurate and compassionate readings. Psychic Medium | Cassandra Blizzard | Seven Years of Surrender | The Paranormal | Author Psychic Cassandra Blizzard
item.content:encoded:
Cassandra Blizzard is an accomplished, award-winning author, with over 30 novels to her credit. She has been writing since the age of 15 and has published numerous short stories, articles, and books. Cassandra is known for her skills in hopping genres. She has written in nearly every genre, including romance, mystery, thriller, science fiction, and mainstream. She has recently added to her list of writing accomplishments with a spiritual non-fiction series, the first of which is titled Seven Years of Surrender. In fiction, she writes page turning novels that keep readers avidly engaged. Cassandra’s non-fiction series, which just debuted, promises to be an eye-opening series of revelatory books designed to broaden the reader’s understanding of the soul and the spiritual realm. Cassandra also writes under the names: E.J. Deen, C.D. Blizzard and Cassandra Ormand. Cassandra is also one of the world’s most detailed psychic mediums. She is internationally known for her evidential mediumship skills as well as her psychic abilities, with clients on nearly every continent. Cassandra is known for her accurate and compassionate readings. You may find out more about Cassandra by visiting her web-site Cassandra Bizzard Psychic Medium and view her latest release, Seven Years of Surrender @ Amazon Join us via the chat room or call in live for a chance at a live reading and talk to our guest @ 213-769-0952 9PM EST, 8PM CST, 7PM Mountain, 6PM PST

item.title: Creativity In Writing with Special Guest Pat Bertram - Dec 23,2011
item.description:
Pat Bertram is a native of Colorado. When the traditional publishers stopped publishing her favorite type of book — character and story driven novels that can’t easily be slotted into a genre — she decided to write her own. Second Wind Publishing liked her style and published four of Bertram’s books: Light Bringer, Daughter Am I, More Deaths Than One, and A Spark of Heavenly Fire. Bertram blogs about writing and the writing life at http://patbertram.com/ Becka Johnson had been abandoned on the doorstep of a remote cabin in Chalcedony, Colorado when she was a baby. Now, thirty-seven years later, she has returned to Chalcedony to discover her identity, but she only finds more questions. Who has been looking for her all those years? Why are those same people interested in fellow newcomer Philip Hansen? Who is Philip, and why does her body sing in harmony with his? And what do either of them have to do with a shadow corporation that once operated a secret underground installation in the area? Bertrams publisher says: "I was told by some other small publishers with whom I had done research that I was going to get mountains of unacceptable crap for every worthy thing I received. So when I got Pats manuscript for A Spark of Heavenly Fire, which was like the first submission to Second Wind, I thought, OMG, is this possible?! I knew in the first 20 pages that she was the real thing." Join us as we speak of speculative genre, new forms of creativity and Pats journey to find the perfect venue for her writings. Visit via the chat room or call in @ 213-769-0952 to speak live on-air with the author.

item.title: Inside the Mind of Action-Thriller Author LeRochelle Millett - Dec 16,2011
item.description:
Originally from the Bay area, LeRochelle Millett relocated to the wide open spaces of the Sonoran Desert to live in sunny Fountain Hills, Arizona. It was there that his creativity flourished. With a rich history in songwriting and infommercial production, Le set his sites on fulfilling a lifelong dream to write a full-length fiction novel. His first work, Shield of The Blue Ring truly captures the essence of his imagination while showcasing his passion for the unsong hero, physical fitness, action, and adventure. Do any of us really know who or what we can become when faced with insurmountable odds? In life, even the most unlikely of bystanders can emerge from the shadows of obscurity to rise above the occasion—to be the hero. Dr. Earnest Recker, an eccentric Bio-Genetic Physicist, develops a method of cloning superhuman police soldiers with the goal of providing national security to the highest bidder. His innovation shrouds a more sinister objective—world domination. His scheme is threatened by the intuition of a spicy New York City Detective named Lisa Brodlin. A major blunder in the doctor’s plan opens the door for James Fleming to come to light. He’s an introverted Jazz pianist with a secret, of which the full potential is yet to be realized. As the two set out on a quest of self-discovery, they must confront super beings possessing unique abilities and high-tech weaponry. Fleming and Brodlin’s lives bisect each other as one seeks to understand the past and the other is determined to unravel the mystery surrounding the Shield of the Blue Ring. This novel is the first in the James Fleming Series. Available @ Amazon Kindle edition Join us in the chat room or call in to speak with our guest @ 213-769-0952 9PM EST, 8PM CST, 7PM Mountain, 6PM PST

item.title: What Is Normal? with Author Ginny Scales-Medeiros - Dec 09,2011
item.description:
Normal is relative, and Normal for Sue growing up was High School dropout teenage parents, backwoods strict Baptist rituals, pedophiles, poorly made clothes...living in a trailer that is now a chicken coop. Now, Normal is discovering the power of lying, stealing, alcohol, drugs and mastering the Art of Selling along the way. Normal is making Headline News, inventing a new product, landing in a movie and creating a real, not normal life. Virginia (Ginny) Scales-Medeiros Born and raised in rural upstate New York now resides in the San Francisco North Bay Area. , Finishing only the 9th grade and getting her GED Ginny has many accomplishments including being an entrepreneur, a real-estate investor, an inventor with multiple patents and trademarks, animal lover and advocate for animal rights. With her first invention she won 1st place in a national contest for the best new idea/product . A master marketer she was a record-breaking salesperson in the auto industry and created over a million dollars of free publicity for her sunless tanning invention including being an on air guest on QVC. Recently she has been a speaker for 100% electric transportation, on the board of Directors for ZAP a PR/Marketing Consultant and can be seen in the 2011 movie, “What is the Electric Car?” Presently, she is focusing on speaking engagements and promotions about her upcoming book, “What is Normal?” and was the on-air interview guest on The Stevie Mack Show, The Personal Best Show in Chicago, not to mention Dr Phil, OWN and perhaps a made for TV movie contract., She has a Literary Agent and a Publishing Contract. Visit Ginnys website: http://whatisnormal.tv/ginny/ Join us by calling in to speak with Ginny @ 213-769-0952 or visit and listen via the chat room. 9PM EST, 8PM CST, 7PM Mountain, 6PM PST

item.title: New Beginnings with Author and Publisher Marlene - Dec 02,2011
item.description:
Born in Kingston, Jamaica, Marlene moved to the United States at the age of eight. Her love for books began her very first summer in the U.S. when her stepmother literally dragged her to the library;a way to keep her off the streets. As if a match made in heaven Marlene took to reading like a fish to water. Some favorite authors were Laura Ingalls Wilder, Beverley Cleary and Judy Blume. Growing up in a house with 3 brothers she was lucky to find an author like Ms. Blume to educated her on the trials and tribulations of being a young girl. Marlene laughingly states that due to having a tight-lipped, strict stepmother she was happy to have access to books as Are You There God, It’s Me Margaret, Blubber and Forever to keep her informed as she advance into womanhood. Marlene began writing poetry at the age of 11 and from that point on she felt lost if she didn’t have a pen and her trusty composition notebook with her.. In 2005 Marlene self-published, her first book Babies’ Daddies. She published her second book ‘Making It In My Own’ in 2006, ‘Island Beauty’ followed on June 1, 2009. Her most recent release came out on June 15, 2011 titled Jamaican Gal. Marlene states that she wrote this book to bring some of the island feel to the readers. She rarely saw books depicting her home or use of the dialect. Drawing from her memories and experiences of her first eight years, she painted a vivid picture of what it was like living in Jamaica, moving to a different country at such a young age and trying to integrate into such a different culture. She is currently working on her fifth book Babies Daddies-The Remix, and a novella titled, UnWanted. http://www.authormarlene.webs.com/ Join us 213-769-0952 9PM EST, 8PM CST, 6PM PST

item.title: The MIracle of Love with special guest Al Diaz - Nov 23,2011
item.description:
Al Diaz is an International and Keynote speaker and author of “The Titus Concept” and “Confirmations”. “Ilumine Ao” expresses in a combination of Spanish and Hawaiian “Illuminate Light” and in that inspiration it is done for the best and highest good of all.” This is what Al represents. Al’s parents were part of a hard working class in Mexico, who migrated to the United States and became hard working middle class in the U.S., and consequently was raised with the “hard work ethic” to have the money for the things he wanted. Without realizing it Al accepted most of his first 30 years of Life experiences as fact and truth and that is how he functioned and lived for 40+ years. This resulted in having an inflated ego with low self-esteem and constantly seeking instant gratification. Those three characteristics added up to FEAR. During that time period Al wondered “Is this how life is supposed to be? Were some of us were here to struggle while others were lucky and had all the breaks?” After an accident that resulted having a severe concussion, Al knew he needed to heal physically and through daily meditations realized he also needed to heal mentally, emotionally and spiritually. This was the beginning for Al in enhancing his overall wellbeing and in this part of his journey he searched for answers and the truth of others, read as many books as he could, had great mentors, went to seminars, and did everything to keep moving forward in life. Al Diaz says … Clarity is what produced the steps called The Titus Concept.. All this has inspired the vision of Al and Ilumine Ao to bring forth The Miracle of Love in powerful local, national and international events. Call in @ 213-769-0952 or visit via the chatroom 8PM EST, 7PM CST, 6PM Mountain 5PM PST

item.title: Inside the Mind of Crime Horror Author Richard Godwin - Nov 21,2011
item.description:
Richard Godwin is a crime and horror author as well as a produced playwright and poet. He has been widely published in magazines and anthologies. Apostle Rising is his first published novel. Detective Chief Inspector Frank Castle never caught the Woodlands Killer and it almost destroyed him. Now many years later and still suffering from nightmares, he is faced with a copycat killer with detailed inside knowledge of the original case. Someone is crucifying politicians, and Castle and his partner DI Jacki Stone enter a labyrinth. At its centre is the man Castle believes was responsible for the first killings. He’s running a sinister cult and playing mind games with the police. The ritualistic killer keeps raising the stakes and slipping through their hands. The body count is rising. . item.title: Preparing For The Inevitable with guest Carolyn A Brent - Nov 18,2011
item.description:
Carolyn A. Brent, author of the book Why Wait? The Baby Boomers Guide to Preparing Emotionally, Financially & Legally for a Parents Death, is a guide for family caregivers and aging parents As a speaker, she travels throughout the United States lecturing about the importance of adult siblings and parents having what she calls “crucial conversations” in preparation for the end-of-life issues they may face, so instead of being torn apart, they can come together as a strong family. She is committed to enhancing the lives of family caregivers and their aging parents throughout the world. Carolyn’s passion for her subject started when she was caring for her own father, who was diagnosed with dementia in 1997. From that experience, she found that neither she nor her family truly understood not only the medical challenges related to aging and chronic illness, but also the financial and emotional weight that these bring to bear on a family. In 2009, she founded her business Grandpa’s Dream and the non-profit organization Caregiver Story for the dissemination of information through books, speaking engagements and a web-based info portal, with the hopes of them becoming instruments of positive change for other families who were experiencing the same pain and heartache that she experienced, and who were being challenged by the need to plan for their aging parents’ medical, financial, and legal well-being. http://www.caregiverstory.com http://www.babyboomersguide.org Call in at 213-769-0952 to speak with Carolyn or visit via the chatroom. 8PM EST, 7PM CST, 6PM Mountain, 5PM PST

item.title: Author Jennifer Maggio talks of Being A Single Mom - Nov 11,2011
item.description:
Author/Speaker Jennifer Maggio is considered a leading authority on single parent issues. She is the critically-acclaimed author of Overwhelmed and The Church and the Single Mom. Jennifer runs one of the nations largest single mom support groups & has helped launch more than 100 others world-wide. She is currently a columnist with Halo Magazine and Single Parents Town and is founder of Overwhelmed: The Single Moms Magazine. She has been featured on more than 100 radio and television shows. Ms. Maggio is leaving audiences everywhere riveted with her inspiring story of how she journeyed from homeless, abused, teen mother to 11-time Circle of Excellence Winner in Corporate America. For more information, visit http://www.jennifermaggio.com. To speak to Jennifer, call in at 213-769-0952 8PM EST, 7PM CST, 6PM Mountain, 5PM PST

item.title: Post Traumatic Stress & Other Musings, guest Brian Heffron - Nov 04,2011
item.description:
Brian Heffronis a staff writer/director/producer at KLCS-TV/DT, an Educational PBS Station licensed to the Los Angeles Unified School District where he creates programming to assist and improve student outcomes. He has worked at almost every position on a motion picture set from grip to props to Production Design and was eventually the Director of Photography on the independent feature film, “The Imported Bridegroom”. Since leaving Emerson College with a BFA in Writing (Russell Banks was his Writer in Residence and main instructor) he has supported himself as a movie screenwriter and TV producer/director. Prior to that he wasa Professional Sailor, a Celestial Navigator, a Carpenter, a Painter, even a drill Prees Operator. Since joining KLCS he has won nine Telly Awards, eleven Aurora Awards, two Emmys two Videographer Awards and a Davis Award. He is credited with creating the first animated web-series on AOL: “Hollywood Nights”, and was the Creative Director of a clip-art company that created almost all the clip-art images within MSWord. As a writer he has published articles in Backstage, American Cinematographer, Cruising World and Sail. His poems have appeared in Rockport Review, Ploughshares, Poetry, Poems, and the Burlington Review. His poetry is deeply romantic and infused with images of nature and love. Learn more at Brians web-site: Brian Heffron Call in at 213-769-0952 to speak with our guest and hosts or join in and listen via the chatroom. 8PM EST, 7PM CST, 6PM Mountain, 5PM PST

item.title: Halloween Special with Witchcraft High Priest Scott Tarbox - Oct 28,2011
item.description:
Scott Tarbox is a High Priest of Celtic/English Witchcraft, The Torbuc Tradition of Witchcraft, as well as Strega, Hekatean with a deep understanding and intiations in Kahuna, Golden Dawn, Gardnerian, Alexandrian, Santeria, HooDoo and VooDoo. He is currently a member in high standing of the following:The Witches of Salem Official Council of Elders,High Priest and Elder of The Temple of Keys, Coven of Keys, C.O.R. and The Temple of Hekate. In 2005, he founded The Witches of Salem Official Council of Elders.On July 28th, 2007 he was touched by the Sword of the Lady initiated once again and made King of Witches. Scott was born a Witch and has been teaching Witchcraft as a Religion and Way of Life for over 30 years. He teaches and consults online by telephone and in person and is available for lectures, classes and readings. Scott, for the past several years, has been working on authoring his own books on Witchcraft and is currently nearing completion. Scott has lectured the local Police Departments, Social Services and even helped missing persons cases as well as murder cases. Along with this, Scott creates capes and robes for ritual or everyday wear.along with jewelry, candles, spell cords, wands, staffs etc. for all that walk the Path of the Witch. Mr. Tarbox is proud of his Witchcraft and Native American heritages. And has been a Psychic reader for over 30 years." Join us as we take an inside look at the reality of Witchcraft and what it embraces. You may be surprised. Call in at 213-769-0952 or listen via the chat room. 8PM EST, 7PM CST, 6PM Mountain, 5PM PST

item.title: The Power of WOW, author and Studio U coach Lori Woolridge - Oct 21,2011
item.description:
Lori Bryant-Woolridge, is an Emmy Award-winning writer and best-selling author, sensuality coach, and advocate for healthy, sensual lifestyles. She has authored three best-selling books, including Weapons of Mass Seduction, a sensuality manual within a novel, and has edited the erotic anthology Can’t Help the Way That I Feel. Lori conducts sensuality classes and workshops around the nation, and has been featured in local and national media including the Seattle Times, the Detroit Free Press, the New York Daily News, Essence Magazine, Romantic Times, Working Mother Magazine, Cosmopolitan UK, and Psychologies Magazine (UK), and has appeared on numerous radio and television shows across the country. In Loris own words "We want you to live by your own truths, attitudes, wants and desires, only then will you begin to know the true pleasure of being a woman." Call in and talk to our guest and hosts at 213-769-0952 or visit via the friendly chat room Women - time you found the WOW factor hidden within. 8PM EST, 7PM CST, 6PM Mountain, 5PM PST

item.title: E.T. famed Star and renowned author Dee Wallace - Oct 12,2011
item.description:
Hollywood actress and star of the film E.T. shares spiritual wisdom learned from a life in acting Like all of us, Dee Wallace came in as a bright shiny light, and she knew from the beginning that her soul quest was to keep that light shining and share it with others. Bright Light is an autobiographical tale of how the actor’s craft became a spiritual journey for her, and how she applied those lessons to her life. It is also a story of Everyman: how we lose our light and steps we can take to reclaim it. For Dee Wallace has discovered, like her co-star E.T., that the journey home comes from following the heart’s lead. Call in to speak to our special guest at 213-769-0952 or visit the chat room 8PM EST, 7PM CST, 6PM Mountain, 5PM PST Visit Dees website http://iamdeewallace.com/home/About.html

item.title: A Conversation with Bled Out author Glenn Parkhurst - Oct 07,2011
item.description:
Eighteen-year-old Kenny Arthur wishes he was just a typical kid from the small town of Friendship, New York, but a near death experience and a message from the other side made that impossible. Now Kenny knows there’s a plague coming and it’s not natural. He knows it can crush the life out of this world and reach up into heaven itself. And he knows he’s the only one who can stop it. What he doesn’t know is how. Join us as we speak with author, photographer, father, and humanitarian Glenn Parkhurst. HIs life has been anything but boring. His writings of humor, horror and romance will touch your very soul. Call in to speak to Glenn and the hosts at 213-769-0952 or visit via the chat room 8PM EST, 7PM CST, 6PM Mountain, 5PM PST

item.title: Fate-Destiny with Hand of the Omega author Katherine Whitley - Sep 30,2011
item.description:
What would you do to save the life of someone you love? What could you sacrifice to save your own soul? Special Agent Will Taylor and his reluctant partner, Jackson Allen, have formed an uneasy and unlikely friendship, but are now bonded forever due to the complicated hand of Fate interlocking the two by family and circumstance. As they settle into their new lives, the Fallen plots the demise of mankind by horrific means; using the Society’s love and Commitment to one another to create the havoc and negativity causing tragedies the world over. No sacrifice is too great, and unimaginable pain willingly suffered as they must fight both separately and as a team to bring an end to this evil that threatens to destroy The Society, and take world along for the ride. Along the way, the hard lessons of fate, destiny and life are both taught and learned by everyone involved in the struggle for both the salvation of the world and the understanding that life is not about the individual; but about the ultimate plan. And one’s final destination, Katherine Whitley loves to write! And write and write. The state of Vermont is a great factor in providing the surroundings that create inspiration. The beauty; the pure joy of the seasons. It was enough to pull her away from her Florida roots and establish a home in the New England area, which she shares with her husband, three of her four children and two dogs. When not writing, Katherine makes others hair beautiful and also is a nurse, providing care for elderly and rehab patients. Join us to discuss what part fate and destiny play within our lives and Katherines new release Hand of the Omega. Call in to speak live with the author and hosts at 213-769-0952 or visit via the chatroom 8PM EST, 7PM CST, 6PM Mountain, 5PM EST

item.title: Apartheid Chat with 'Dark Moon' author Maggie Tideswell - Sep 17,2011
item.description:
In Maggies own words, "I was a child in the apartheid era. I didnt notice anything. It was just the way it was " Join us as we discuss Apartheid along with Ms. Tidewells soon to be released novel, Dark Moon.. Maggie Tideswell was born in Nelspruit, Mpumalanga, middle child of a parasitologist and a school teacher. As a young girl she professed to her mother that she was going to be a writer. After being accepted at the City of Cape Towns Dance Studio, Maggie turned to an education in teaching rather than pursue her professional dancing career. She has been married for 31 years with 3 children and 2 grandchildren, who saw Maggie emerge from a dabbler in writing to becoming a published author. Call in at 213-769-0952 or visit the chat room 2PM EST, 1PM CST, NOON Mountain, 11AM PST

item.title: All Medicines are Poison with MPH,MD Melvin H. Kirschner - Sep 16,2011
item.description:
After medical training at the University of Southern California and the Los Angeles County General Hospital, Dr. Kirschner entered medical practice in the San Fernando Valley as a family physician. In 1961 there were very few doctors with his pubic health experience. This soon led to volunteering in various health related programs, such as the Regional Medical Disaster Program, the Red Cross Disaster and Blood program, the Home Health Association, Visiting Nurse Association, Hospice, several committees on biomedical issues, adviser to the California Health Law Revision Committee, Single Payer Health Care for All, Physicians for a National Health Plan, California Physicians Alliance and other health-related activities. He has also written numerous articles, letters and Op Ed pieces and appeared on radio, television and lectured on health care issues at many venues. Recently retired from medical practice, he continues to volunteer for many health oriented community programs. This book is a collection of essays by Dr. Kirschner, regarding some of the many unresolved health care, pharmaceutical and insurance issues that his patients have shared with him during his forty-seven years of family medical practice. Join us as we delve into these fascinating topics by calling in live at 213-769-0952 or visit via the chat room. 8PM EST, 7PM CST, 6PM Mountain, 5PM PST

item.title: Food Not Bombs with co-founder Keith McHenry - Sep 09,2011
item.description:
Keith McHenry age 54, cofounder of the Food Not Bombs movement. Lives in Taos, New Mexico. Keith helped start Food Not Bombs in 1980 in Boston, MA He was arrested nearly 100 times for "making a political statement" by sharing vegan meals with the hungry in San Francisco. He designed the Food Not Bombs logo and co-wrote the book "Food Not Bombs, How to Feed the Hungry and Build Community." He was arrested for sharing food in Orlando with Jessica Cross and Ben Markeson on June 1, 2011 For the last fifteen years, Keith has been touring the world and starting up new Food Not Bombs groups. On a personal level, Keith suffers extreme pain every day from fibromyalgia caused by police violence. Presently, Keith focuses his attention helping provide food to families struggling because of the global economic crisis. http://www.foodnotbombs.net/keithbio.html Join us 8PM EST, 7PM CST, 6PM Mountain

item.title: Footballs "Dirty Little Secret" with Semi-Pro Keshawn Durant - Sep 02,2011
item.description:
Author Keshawn Durant, a college and semi-pro football player, takes a closer look at pro footballs dirty little secret:- depression. When an injury ended his career early, Durant experienced firsthand an athletes descent into depression. It became the biggest opponent of his life. Now a spokesman for depression, he has been featured on TSN and a variety of radio stations and blogs. He hosts a weekly teleseminar - covering topics such as depression, goal-setting, and athletics. He is from a sports family. His brother, Darian, plays for the CFLs Saskatchewan Roughriders and his brother, Justin, plays for the NFLs Jacksonville Jaguars. Join Keshawn by calling in @ 213-769-0952 or listen in via our chat room. 8PM EST, 7PM CST, 6PM Mountain, 5PM PST

item.title: When Tragedy Strikes with Sue Henley,Karen Keilt, Phil Finn - Aug 26,2011
item.description:
How do you overcome such obstacles as suicide, a childs death, torture, crime or a major illness? This show will center on three people who have not only gone through such strife in life, but ultimately came out winners. Meet Rev Sue Henley, author of Because of Sean and ordained spiritual Peace Minister with the Beloved Community and Universal Life Church. Karen Keilt, author of the recently released novel and soon to be released motion picture, The Parrots Perch, Phil Finn, who overcame what most felt was a certain death sentence of cancer. Author and psychologist Kenneth Weene will be our special guest host this evening as we delve into human tragedy and how we cope with it. Call in at 213-769-0952 or visit the chat room 8PM EST, 7PM CST, 6PM Mountain, 5PM PST

item.title: Child Abuse Part II-Marco Bernardino, Sr & Helen Wisocki - Aug 19,2011
item.description:
Young Marco, blissfully living with his grandparents, is whisked away to a new school when his parents re-enter his life. Befriended by Father McCool, Marco is groomed with methodical precision, exclusive indulgences, and thrilling sports outings. Slowly, he is introduced to profound abuse by those whom he trusted. Author, Marco L. Bernardino, Sr. is a survivor of clergy sexual abuse and works to bring hope and help to others in similar situations. He has five children and lives in Marlton, New Jersey, where he works for the state as a Senior Project Development Officer. Mr. Bernardino aspires for Sins of the Abused to offer a path to recovery for victims who feel alienated from mainstream society—a direct and insufferable result of the actions of predators lurking in the shadows of our churches. Website: http://sinsoftheabused.webs.com/ Author, Helen J. Wisocki has two grown children, owns a retail business in Newburyport, and resides in Massachusetts. She has published shorts stories in the anthologies, Forever Friends and Forever Travels. She co-authored Innocence Betrayed while helping others put their life stories on paper. Website: http://www.helenwisoki.com

item.title: ATTMP's 2nd Pitch Your Book to the Publisher Contest - Aug 17,2011
item.description:
Calling all serious authors! Join us for an opportunity to query ATTMP, live on-air. Each author will be given 5 minutes to present the books concept. This includes reading a small excerpt from your work. Rules: Your book must be complete and ready to submit You must have visited ATTMPs web-site and read their contract and submission terms All authors works heard on air will be considered for publication. At the end of the broadcast, voting will begin and the lucky author(s) will gain priority review status from the publishers. The winners will be announced during our live September 1st broadcast. Be sure to go to ATTMP and read the terms and conditions prior to calling into the show. Between calls, publishers Phil and Debra Harris will take part in question and answer sessions

item.title: Child Abuse, Part I with guest author Cynthia Miller - Aug 12,2011
item.description:
Cynthia Miller grew up in Michigan, Oklahoma and California. Cynthia is known for her inspirational poetry. She also conducts poetry workshops and has developed a program entitled Poetry In Motion, which she teaches to elementary school students. She now lives in Phoenix with her son Raymond. Together they have moved on. A message from Cynthia…….. This story was written to allow my audience to see deep inside the walls of survival. We have all watched the story of the abused child on the crime channels. But few of us have seen what happened the next day and the next and the next. I wrote this story so that I could take you inside of survival. Sometimes it is not pretty. But in the end I know that you will believe in the human spirit and the will to survive that is buried in all of us. I want this story to save lives. I want the mother that reads this story to peek in on her baby’s one more time tonight. I want the addict that reads this story to find their way out of the darkness. And for those of you that have never had to wake up inside a tunnel to reach out to those who do. Remember, there is always a rainbow after the storm. You just have to look up. Visit Cynthia Millers web-site: In Rare Form Join us 8:00 PM EST, 7PM CST, 6PM Mountain, 5PM PST

I wrote this story so that I could take you inside of survival. Sometimes it is not pretty. But in the end I know that you will believe in the human spirit and the will to survive that is buried in all of us. I want this story to save lives. I want the mother that reads this story to peek in on her baby’s one more time tonight. I want the addict that reads this story to find their way out of the darkness. And for those of you that have never had to wake up inside a tunnel to reach out to those who do. Remember, there is always a rainbow after the storm. You just have to look up. Visit Cynthia Millers web-site: In Rare Form Join us 8:00 PM EST, 7PM CST, 6PM Mountain, 5PM PST

item.title: One Big Mistake with Wedlocked author Bonnie Trachtenberg - Aug 10,2011
item.description:
On what should be the happiest day of her life, Rebecca Ross is panic stricken. Rebecca has just wed Craig Jacobs, but she realizes she put more thought into choosing her florist than she did in choosing the man she’s just pledged to love for the rest of her life Join author Bonnie Trachtenberg as we discuss her book Wedlocked and how bad decisions can affect your life. Bonnie Trachtenberg worked as Senior Writer and Copy Chief at Book-of-the-Month Club and has written seven children’s book adaptations. She’s also written for three newspapers, and has penned countless magazine articles. Wedlocked is her first novel. She lives on Long Island with her husband, stepchildren, and cats. Visit Bonnies web-site: http://www.BonnieTrachtenberg.com Call in to speak with our guest at 213-769-0952 or visit via the chat room. 8PM EST, 7PM CST, 6PM Mountain, 5PM PST

item.title: Homeless In Los Angeles with producer Brandon James Miller - Aug 05,2011
item.description:
Brandon James has produced documentaries, music videos, commercials and independent films for festival circuits and television broadcast on a national and international basis including PBS. Prior to The Homeless Project, Brandon James created a series of videos for the Arizona Dept. of Environmental Quality to educate the citizens of Litchfield Park on the importance of recycling. He has helped dozens of charitable organizations create awareness campaigns aimed at educating citizens on youth abandonment, abusive homes, and uplifting the civilians enlightenment on important pertinent information regarding the communities they live in. Brandon James has a Bachelor Degree in Film and HIgh Definition technology and has based his career off of providing awareness for non-profit organizations via motion pictures for the benefit of society. Visit The Homeless Projects website: http://www.youarehomeless.org/ Join us this evening as we dicuss Brandons remarkable talent and true care for both people and our worlds environment. Call in at 213-769-0952 8PM EST, 7PM CST, 6PM Mountain, 5PM PST

item.title: 200 Shorts with author, poet Salvatore Buttaci - Jul 29,2011
item.description:
Salvatore Buttaci has been writing since childhood. His first published work was an article entitled "Presidential Timber" that appeared in the Sunday New York News when he was fifteen. Buttaci was graduated from Seton Hall University in 1965 with a B.A. in Communication Arts. His major was drama, and he has written and directed several full-length plays for educational theater. In 1981, he earned an M.B.A. in marketing from Rutgers Graduate School of Management and was a marketing executive for 12 years. Before retiring in June 2007, he taught English on both middle school and college levels in New Jersey. He is currently editor of The Word Place and author of, Family of Sicilians: Flashing My Shorts, and 200 Shorts to name a few . Sal collaborated on many songs with his musician brother Alfonso. Four of their songs were background music in a 1989 movie, Fortress of Amerikkka. He is a publisher-member of ASCAP. Buttaci now lives in Princeton, West Virginia, with the love of his life, his wife Sharon.

item.title: Two Unsynchronized Souls-Understanding Men-David Simonsen - Jul 27,2011
item.description:
Women, have you ever wondered how a man really thinks? Join us as we discuss what actually runs through a mans mind as we talk with author and creative solutions counselor, David Simonsen. You may very well learn aspects of the male makeup you never knew existed. And who better to share the male mind set than a man. David has a Masters degree in Marriage & Family Therapy from Seattle Pacific University and is licensed in the state of Washington as a Marriage & Family Therapist. He is a member of American Association for Marriage & Family Therapists (AAMFT) American Association of Christian Counselors (AACC)and Washington Association of Marriage & Family Therapists (WAMFT) Davids videos and web-site: http://help4life.net/ Join us 8PM EST, 7PM CST, 6PM Mountain, 5PM PST

item.title: Two Unsynchronized Souls- Embracing Diversity David Cowdery - Jul 22,2011
item.description:
David Cowdery, pen name, Davis Aujourdhui is creator of the hilarious Sister Mary Olga Fortitude series of religious and social satires. The Misadventures of Sister Mary Olga Fortitude and Babes in Bucksnort are the highly rated books currently published. He has written additional books in the series and hasnt run out of ideas yet. As will be the case with the title character in his next book, he is a recovering alcoholic. He also happens to be gay as are several of the endearing and humorous characters within his novels. David speaks from his own experience. He has possessed all of the foibles of his cast of characters, including those naughty, nasty, and nice. Mr. Cowdery lives in Upstate New York. He is socially-minded and spirituality is the most important ingredient for him in order to maintain a happy and successful life. Join us 8PM EST, 7PM CST, 6PM Mountain, 5PM PST

item.title: Two Unsynchronized Souls-Spiritual Weight Loss- Gerri Helms - Jul 20,2011
item.description:
“When God made YOU, He was just showing off!” Are you ready to experience it? Gerri Helms is a Certified Spiritual Coach and Dynamic Speaker, with twenty-five years experience in the corporate setting. She started her coaching practice in 2006, helping people with life changes, spiritual goals and in the area of weight loss and maintenance, having lost over one hundred pounds and maintaining that for seventeen plus years. Gerri is a popular guest speaker, having addressed the American Business Women’s Association, the Food Addiction Professionals Association, Space Coast Mental Health Counselors Association, The Indian River Methodist Church, and many others. She has been a guest on many radio shows, including AM Radio WMEL 921; Women are Talking Show and the morning show on 97.7FM – The Wolf in San Francisco, and many blog-talk radio shows. Gerri has been featured in the Brevard County edition of the Florida Today newspaper and Brevard County Woman magazine. Gerris website - http://lifecoachgerri.com/

Using ILD, Llife quality can be increased AND be supportive to any transitions occuring, lifestyle changes or health challenges. item.title: Two Unsynchronized Souls-Moving On In Your LIfe-Carl Mathis - Jul 01,2011
item.description:
His motivational speeches move mountains. He doesn’t make excuses for his struggles—he uses them as stepping stones to get to higher levels in his God-ordained destiny. Carl Mathis doesn’t know what it means to give up. Overcoming the obstacles of losing a spouse, having to raise three successful boys on his own and manage to write two books, he never managed to find the time to make excuses. Through his triumph over personal troubles, he strives to not only inspire and uplift, but to encourage people worldwide to find their purpose and begin walking in it. Mr. Mathis is the author of Life Is What You Make It, Seven Steps to Moving Forward http://www.carlmathis.com/ Join us as we discuss overcoming personal hurdles and coming out a winner. 8PM EST, 7PM CST, 6PM Mountain, 5PM PST 213-769-0952

item.description:

Lorene Benoit discovered her passion http://www.naturalpathremedies.com/blog/ for natural healing, herbs and nutrition in 1974. After ten years teaching K - College, she began to dedicate her life to sharing and teaching others about effective natural health. Since the mid 1980s, Lorene Benoit has emerged as a leading natural health and holistic practitioner, wellness coach, trainer and author. She has trained Certified Herbalists and Natural Health Consultants and helped many start their own business. item.title: 'The LIghter Side of Polygomy, guest author Adele Park - Jun 24,2011
item.description:
Join us as we discuss polygamy with author Adele Park and her recently released audio book, aptly titled, Jitters-A Quirky Little Audio Book WHEN RADIO AND POLYGAMY COLLIDE . . . For radio shock jock Nancy Neptune, life is just one big promotion. But when shes sent to work at a radio station near a polygamist compound in Utah, trouble comes in triplicate. In a land where one good wife deserves another, Nancy Neptune hooks up with a drag queen and a one-armed reporter to rescue a mentally challenged polygamist who is being abused by one of his nine mommies and neglected by the other eight. Jitters-A Quirky Little Audio Book is narrated through a series of news reports with the characters reacting to the events of the day. Jitters features a cast of 15 actors who tell their stories in first person narratives. Dont miss this wacky ride through polygamist country, where the local radio station becomes a part of every news story they broadcast! Adele Park spent more than 20 years of her career working in television and radio as a reporter, news anchor and on-air personality. During that time, Park earned several top journalism awards from The Associated Press, Colorado Broadcasters Association and Utah Broadcasters Association. Park has also worked in the print media; her articles and photos have been published in a variety of magazines. In 2008, Park formed Straight to Audio Productions L.L.C. And opened a recording studio in St. George, Utah. Call in or visit our chat room to speak with guest Adele Park. 8PM EST, 7PM CST, 6PM Mountain, 5PM PST

item.title: Raciscm Part II, Blind Bigotry special guest YoonOK Kim - Jun 23,2011
item.description:
We welcome a very special guest this evening, Ms. YoonOK Kim, author,poet, humanitarian and Green Gardener in Part II on our Racism series. In Ms. Kims own words: Time to stop Racism, Slavery, Exploitation, And Inhumanity! When the power, politics and the social system of patriarchy work together with prejudice and bias for the conflict of interest, the inhumanity of racism can be continually motivated and expanded on the ideas of racial discrimination over skin colors, gender, language, place of birth or other factors. The definition of Racism from Cambridge Dictionary Online: “the belief that peoples qualities are influenced by their race and that the members of other races are not as good as the members of your own, or the resulting unfair treatment of members of other races”. Join us this evening as we discuss how racism affects many cultures and races throughout the world. 213-769-0952 8PM PST, 7PM CST, 6PM Mountain, 5PM PST YoonOKs website: http://www.smashwords.com/profile/view/YoonOk

item.title: Two Unsynchronized Souls-Achieving Your Dreams & Goals - Jun 22,2011
item.description:
We are pleased to have as our guest, Darshan G. Shanti, in his own words states: "I understand how much you’re hurting. I feel your pain, desperation, worry and fear. Take heart my friend. I’ve been there and I have come out on the other side, healthy, wealthy and happy. You can and you will too. I know this without a doubt because I know the truth of you. You are priceless, magnificent, incredible, a winner and a champion. Anything that stops you from realizing that must be eliminated. Or like a weed, it will keep coming back over and over again. This book will show you the step by step, systematic approach I personally used (and have taught to thousands) to permanently transform their lives. It will help you to free yourself from the ball and chain of your past so you can forget about it. It puts you in the driver’s seat of your own transformation and in control of your own life. It will help you to have your wants and your dreams by enabling you to change your own mind about who you are and your future. When you change your own mind, your change is permanent" Darshan is an expert in human motivation, rapid transformation and helping people eliminate unwanted, self-destructive behaviors in hours, not years. He has a unique ability to very quickly empower participants to change their own mind about who they are, what they want and whats possible, both now and in the future. When they change their own minds, their change is permanent. That leaves them free to make new decisions, take new actions and create new, powerful and fulfilling lives. His personal mission is to reach out and help at least 25 million people through his books, seminars, audio/video programs to discover and replace their core, limiting beliefs, blocks and barriers so they have the freedom to live the powerful, fulfilling and magnificent lives they truly deserve. Call in or chat via the internet 8PM EST, 7PM CST, 6PM Mountain, 5PM PST

item.title: Two Unsynchronized Souls- Religion in Politics-Niels Nielsen - Jun 17,2011
item.description:
Join us as we delve into the matter of how religion played a part, not only in the Obama election, but in the lives of former Presidents, with Professor, Niels C. Nielsen, Jr Niels C. Nielsen, Jr. is the J. Newton Rayzor Professor of Philosophy and Religious Thought emeritus at Rice University in Houston, Texas. Rice is an independent university, neither a state supported school or a church sponsored institution. He was founding chairman of its department of religious studies from 1968 to 1990. His B.A. degree is from George Pepperdine University in Los Angeles, and his B.D. and Ph.D from Yale. He taught in the Yale University Department of Religion before coming to Texas. His professional affiliations include the American Academy of Religion, American Philosophical Society, American Society for the Study of Religion, Society for Buddhist-Christian Studies and the Society for European Culture. His doctoral research at Yale was in contemporary theology. Subsequently he has written in the fields of world religions and religion in Eastern Europe; he traveled extensively researching in these fields. As one reviewer states: "With penetrating analyses of twenty presidents from Washington to Obama, God in the Obama Era is a "must read" for anyone interested in the American presidency, the place of religion in American history and culture, or religion in the Obama campaign and presidency. This erudite, lucid, enlightening book brilliantly illuminates the central icon of American culture, the American presidency. In the aftermath of the presidential election of 2008, in which religion played a greater role than in any election since that of 1960, we are fortunate to receive this book...this important book is rich in insight, lively in style and wide-ranging in scope." Ron Highfield, Blanche E. Seaver Professor of Religion, Pepperdine University Call in or chat via the internet 8PM EST, 7PM CST, 6PM Mountain, 5PM PST

item.title: RACISM Part I, with, special guest E. Joyce Moore - Jun 16,2011
item.description:
What is it like growing up a black woman in the world today? Many of us feel bigotry, racism, prejudice is a thing of the past. After all, didnt we win this fight years ago when Martin Luther King made his famous walk to the White House? Our special guest E. Joyce Moore is a writer of non-fiction and fiction, Author of SHIPS -- to be published in 2011 by All Things That Matter Press -- and an award winning book of poetry, Ramblings Through the Attic of Thought. She has written several childrens books which she looks forward to having published and is currently working on a screenplay and two novels. Joyce is also an advocate for the arts and a fine art curator. Her websites: www.moorhamenterprises.yolasite.com www.mybooksmyblogs.yolasite.com Join us tonight and get the inside scoop on what it is truly like to grow up black in this day and age. You may find it quite eye-opening. We welcome your input and point of view. 213-769-0952 8PM EST, 7PM CST, 6PM Mountain, 5PM EST

item.title: Two Unsynchronized Souls discuss Business Prospects In A Slo - Jun 15,2011
item.description:
Thinking of starting a business but fear the present economy? Join us and special guest Victor Kwegyir as we discuss why the present economy may work for you and not against you. In the midst of the global economic downturn, are great opportunities to be explored. The governments and businesses, are themselves, faced with great uncertainties and are cutting back. At the same time there are many who have taken advantage of the opportunities presented to start and grow successful businesses. “The Business You Can Start - Spotting The Greatest Opportunities In The Economic Downturn” challenges and inspires you to take a second look at the economy, anywhere in the world, and see the Rare Business Opportunities that you can take full advantage of. The facts and opportunities identified by this book help you uncover the secrets that have transformed the lives of many and affirm the fact that times of economic difficulty are opportune times for those willing to apply the principles to succeed. Very importantly, it shows you how to Identify Business Opportunities right where you are and anywhere on the planet. It further explains with clearly defined steps how to develop your ideas, dreams and skills into viable business ventures. It has Proven Winning Strategies and Principles that when applied can greatly help you to start a business, distinguish yourself from the competition and cause your enterprise to grow profitably and successfully. To cap it all, it contains a Comprehensive and Professional Practical Business Plan Guide, structured and designed simply for the users’ greatest flexibility. It can be adapted and used as a guide in writing a plan fit for any purpose. Call in live or chat via the internet 8PM EST, 7PM CST, 6PM Mountain, 5PM PST

item.content:encoded:
Thinking of starting a business but fear the present economy? Join us and special guest Victor Kwegyir as we discuss why the present economy may work for you and not against you. In the midst of the global economic downturn, are great opportunities to be explored. The governments and businesses, are themselves, faced with great uncertainties and are cutting back. At the same time there are many who have taken advantage of the opportunities presented to start and grow successful businesses. “The Business You Can Start - Spotting The Greatest Opportunities In The Economic Downturn” challenges and inspires you to take a second look at the economy, anywhere in the world, and see the Rare Business Opportunities that you can take full advantage of. The facts and opportunities identified by this book help you uncover the secrets that have transformed the lives of many and affirm the fact that times of economic difficulty are opportune times for those willing to apply the principles to succeed.
